name: Harper Lee
bio: Harper Lee was an American novelist best known for her 1960 novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird', which won the Pulitzer Prize.

name: George Orwell
bio: George Orwell was an English novelist, essayist, journalist, and critic, best known for his novels '1984' and 'Animal Farm'.

name: Jane Austen
bio: Jane Austen was an English novelist known primarily for her six major novels which interpret, critique and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
bio: F. Scott Fitzgerald was an American novelist, essayist, screenwriter, and short-story writer, best known for his novel 'The Great Gatsby'.

name: Herman Melville
bio: Herman Melville was an American novelist, short story writer, and poet of the American Renaissance period, best known for his novel 'Moby-Dick'.

name: Leo Tolstoy
bio: Leo Tolstoy was a Russian writer who is regarded as one of the greatest authors of all time, known for his novels 'War and Peace' and 'Anna Karenina'.

name: J.D. Salinger
bio: J.D. Salinger was an American writer best known for his 1951 novel 'The Catcher in the Rye', a classic of teenage angst and rebellion.

name: J.R.R. Tolkien
bio: J.R.R. Tolkien was an English writer, poet, philologist, and academic, best known for his high fantasy works 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings'.

name: J.K. Rowling
bio: J.K. Rowling is a British author, best known for writing the Harry Potter fantasy series, which has won multiple awards and sold more than 500 million copies.
